definition: to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)

sentences.english: It is the first time Ms Merkel has confronted her critics head-on.
sentences.chinese: 這是默克爾首次正面迎擊她的批評者。

sentences.english: Special equipment such as a telephone and life support systems should be anchored.
sentences.chinese: 固定好迎擊設備如電話和人工呼吸系統等。

sentences.english: We will take the aggressors on and wipe them out resolutely.
sentences.chinese: 我們將迎擊侵略者，並堅決地消滅他們。

sentences.english: We'll wait here to meet the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我們將守候在這兒，迎擊敵人。

sentences.english: The two fighters squared away when the bell rang.
sentences.chinese: 鈴一響那兩個拳擊手就擺好迎擊架勢。

sentences.english: Yu xi more show at home send side sitting for Ann in yong in confront cholla frequently wang jun.
sentences.chinese: 宇喜多秀家派脅坂安治在龍仁迎擊全羅道的勤王軍。

definition: to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
Vanuatu, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean
